vriforecasting 0.0.0.9000

    Model fitting and producing short-term forecasts using weekly data with EpiEstim

    Iterate through a time-period as a sliding window to produce short-term forecasts with the EpiEstim model fit

    forecast_time_period_epiestim.Rd

    Function to produce short-term forecasts from objects of class estimate_R

    Usage

    forecast_time_period_epiestim(
  data,
  start_date,
  n_days = 7,
  time_period = "daily",
  type = NULL,
  verbose = FALSE,
  ...
)

    Arguments

    data

    data frame containing two columns: date and confirm (number of cases per week)

    start_date

    Initial starting time-point. Must match a timepoint in the input dataset

    n_days

    Number of days to forecast ahead. Defaults to 7

    time_period

    time period string (e.g. 'daily', 'weekly'). Default is daily

    type

    character Specifies type of epidemic. Must be one of "flu_a", "flu_b", "rsv", "sars_cov2" or "other"

    verbose

    set to true to display progress output

    ...

    Pass on optional arguments from fit_epiestim_model

    Value

    List of class forecast_time_periodstoring quantiles of both daily and weekly forecasts from each sliding window

    Examples

    
#  Daily forecast
forecast_time_period_epiestim(
  data = weekly_transformed_plover_data,
  start_date = "2022-10-02", n_days = 14, type = "flu_a"
)
#> Estimated R for iteration: 1
#> Reconstructed incidence for iteration: 1

forecast_time_period_epiestim(
  data = weekly_transformed_plover_data,
  start_date = "2022-10-02", n_days = 14, type = "flu_a", time_period = "weekly"
)
